body_html:
Which models are you referring to that require manual downloads? And where are you installing from. If you are installing via conda install (and downloading from a conda repository) then that conda copy of Tensorflow is not maintained by the Tensorflow team. It's community run.
For the normal pip version I dont think i've had a problem. However, note that a lot of the models are downloaded via scripts separately to save on space for core Tensorflow.

For the normal pip version I dont think i've had a problem. However, note that a lot of the models are downloaded via scripts separately to save on space for core Tensorflow.
body:
Which models are you referring to that require manual downloads? And where are you installing from. If you are installing via conda install (and downloading from a conda repository) then that conda copy of Tensorflow is not maintained by the Tensorflow team. It's community run. 
For the normal pip version I dont think i've had a problem. However, note that a lot of the models are downloaded via scripts separately to save on space for core Tensorflow.
